verses.verse: And He began <WG757> to teach <WG1321> again <WG3825> by the sea. <WG2281> And such a very <WG4183> great <WG4183> multitude <WG3793> gathered <WG4863> to Him that He got <WG1684> into a boat <WG4143> in the sea <WG2281> and sat <WG2521> down; <WG2521> and the whole <WG3956> multitude <WG3793> was by the sea <WG2281> on the land. <WG1093>
And He was teaching <WG1321> them many <WG4183> things <WG4183> in parables, <WG3850> and was saying <WG3004> to them in His teaching, <WG1322>
"Listen <WG191> [to this]! Behold, <WG2400> the sower <WG4687> went <WG1831> out to sow; <WG4687>
and it came <WG1096> about that as he was sowing, <WG4687> some <WG3739> <WG3303> [seed] fell <WG4098> beside <WG3844> the road, <WG3598> and the birds <WG4071> came <WG2064> and ate <WG2719> it up.

"And other <WG243> [seed] fell <WG4098> on the rocky <WG4075> [ground] where <WG3699> it did not have <WG2192> much <WG4183> soil; <WG1093> and immediately <WG2117> it sprang <WG1816> up because <WG1223> it had <WG2192> no <WG3361> depth <WG899> of soil. <WG1093>
"And after <WG3753> the sun <WG2246> had risen, <WG393> it was scorched; <WG2739> and because <WG1223> it had <WG2192> no <WG3361> root, <WG4491> it withered <WG3583> away. <WG3583>
"And other <WG243> [seed] fell <WG4098> among <WG1519> the thorns, <WG173> and the thorns <WG173> came <WG305> up and choked <WG4846> it, and it yielded <WG1325> no <WG3756> crop. <WG2590>

"And other <WG243> [seeds] fell <WG4098> into the good <WG2570> soil <WG1093> and as they grew <WG305> up and increased, <WG837> they yielded <WG1325> a crop <WG2590> and produced <WG5342> thirty, <WG5144> sixty, <WG1835> and a hundredfold. <WG1540>"
And He was saying, <WG3004> "He who <WG3739> has <WG2192> ears <WG3775> to hear, <WG191> let him hear. <WG191>"
And as soon <WG3753> as He was alone, <WG3441> His followers, <WG3588> <WG4012> along <WG4862> with the twelve, <WG1427> [began] asking <WG2065> Him [about] the parables. <WG3850>

And He was saying <WG3004> to them, "To you has been given <WG1325> the mystery <WG3466> of the kingdom <WG932> of God; <WG2316> but those <WG1565> who are outside <WG1854> get <WG1096> everything <WG3956> in parables, <WG3850>

in order <WG2443> that while seeing, <WG991> they may see <WG991> and not perceive; <WG3708> and while hearing, <WG191> they may hear <WG191> and not understand <WG4920> lest <WG3379> they return <WG1994> and be forgiven. <WG863> "
And He said <WG3004> to them, "Do you not understand <WG3609> this <WG3778> parable <WG3850>? And how <WG4459> will you understand <WG1097> all <WG3956> the parables <WG3850>?
"The sower <WG4687> sows <WG4687> the word. <WG3056>

"And these <WG3778> are the ones who <WG3588> are beside <WG3844> the road <WG3598> where <WG3699> the word <WG3056> is sown; <WG4687> and when <WG3752> they hear, <WG191> immediately <WG2117> Satan <WG4567> comes <WG2064> and takes <WG142> away <WG142> the word <WG3056> which has been sown <WG4687> in them.

"And in a similar <WG3668> way <WG3668> these <WG3778> are the ones on whom seed was sown <WG4687> on the rocky <WG4075> [places,] who, <WG3739> when <WG3752> they hear <WG191> the word, <WG3056> immediately <WG2117> receive <WG2983> it with joy; <WG5479>

and they have <WG2192> no <WG3756> [firm] root <WG4491> in themselves, <WG1438> but are [only] temporary; <WG4340> then, <WG1534> when affliction <WG2347> or <WG2228> persecution <WG1375> arises <WG1096> because <WG1223> of the word, <WG3056> immediately <WG2117> they fall <WG4624> away. <WG4624>
"And others <WG243> are the ones on whom seed was sown <WG4687> among <WG1519> the thorns; <WG173> these <WG3778> are the ones who have heard <WG191> the word, <WG3056>

and the worries <WG3308> of the world, <WG165> and the deceitfulness <WG539> of riches, <WG4149> and the desires <WG1939> for other <WG3062> things <WG3062> enter <WG1531> in and choke <WG4846> the word, <WG3056> and it becomes <WG1096> unfruitful. <WG175>

"And those <WG1565> are the ones on whom seed was sown <WG4687> on the good <WG2570> soil; <WG1093> and they hear <WG191> the word <WG3056> and accept <WG3858> it, and bear <WG2592> fruit, <WG2592> thirty, <WG5144> sixty, <WG1835> and a hundredfold. <WG1540>"

And He was saying <WG3004> to them, "A lamp <WG3088> is not brought <WG2064> to be put <WG5087> under <WG5259> a peck-measure, is it, or <WG2228> under <WG5259> a bed <WG2825>? Is it not [brought] to be put <WG5087> on the lampstand <WG3087>?

"For nothing <WG3756> <WG5100> is hidden, <WG2927> except <WG1437> to be revealed; <WG5319> nor <WG3761> has [anything] been <WG1096> secret, <WG614> but that it should come <WG2064> to light. <WG5318>
"If <WG1487> any <WG5100> man <WG5100> has <WG2192> ears <WG3775> to hear, <WG191> let him hear. <WG191>"

And He was saying <WG3004> to them, "Take <WG991> care <WG991> what <WG5101> you listen <WG191> to. By your standard <WG3358> of measure <WG3354> it shall be measured <WG3354> to you; and more <WG4369> shall be given <WG4369> you besides. <WG4369>

"For whoever <WG3739> has, <WG2192> to him shall [more] be given; <WG1325> and whoever <WG3739> does not have, <WG2192> even <WG2532> what <WG3739> he has <WG2192> shall be taken <WG142> away <WG142> from him."
And He was saying, <WG3004> "The kingdom <WG932> of God <WG2316> is like <WG3779> <WG5613> a man <WG444> who casts <WG906> seed <WG4703> upon the soil; <WG1093>

and goes <WG2518> to bed <WG2518> at night <WG3571> and gets <WG1453> up by day, <WG2250> and the seed <WG4703> sprouts <WG985> up and grows <WG3373> â€“ how, <WG5613> he himself <WG846> does not know. <WG3609>

"The soil <WG1093> produces <WG2592> crops <WG2592> by itself; <WG844> first <WG4413> the blade, <WG5528> then <WG7508> the head, <WG4719> then <WG7508> the mature <WG4134> grain <WG4621> in the head. <WG4719>
"But when <WG3752> the crop <WG2590> permits, <WG3860> he immediately <WG2117> puts <WG649> in the sickle, <WG1407> because <WG3754> the harvest <WG2326> has come. <WG3936>"
And He said, <WG3004> "How <WG4459> shall we picture <WG3666> the kingdom <WG932> of God, <WG2316> or <WG2228> by what <WG5101> parable <WG3850> shall we present <WG5087> it?

"[It is] like <WG5613> a mustard <WG4615> seed, <WG2848> which, <WG3739> when <WG3752> sown <WG4687> upon the soil, <WG1093> though it is smaller <WG3398> than all <WG3956> the seeds <WG4690> that are upon the soil, <WG1093>

yet <WG2532> when <WG3752> it is sown, <WG4687> grows <WG305> up and becomes <WG1096> larger <WG3173> than all <WG3956> the garden <WG3001> plants <WG3001> and forms <WG4160> large <WG3173> branches; <WG2798> so <WG5620> that the birds <WG4071> of the air <WG3772> can <WG1410> nest <WG2681> under <WG5259> its shade. <WG4639> "
And with many <WG4183> such <WG5108> parables <WG3850> He was speaking <WG2980> the word <WG3056> to them as they were able <WG1410> to hear <WG191> it;
and He did not speak <WG2980> to them without <WG5565> a parable; <WG3850> but He was explaining <WG1956> everything <WG3956> privately <WG2596> <WG2398> to His own <WG2398> disciples. <WG3101>
And on that day, <WG2250> when evening <WG3798> had come, <WG1096> He said <WG3004> to them, "Let us go <WG1330> over <WG1330> to the other <WG4008> side. <WG4008>"
And leaving <WG863> the multitude, <WG3793> they took <WG3880> Him along <WG3880> with them, just <WG5613> as He was, in the boat; <WG4143> and other <WG243> boats <WG4143> were with Him.

And there arose <WG1096> a fierce <WG3173> gale <WG2978> of wind, <WG417> and the waves <WG2949> were breaking <WG1911> over <WG1911> the boat <WG4143> so <WG5620> much that the boat <WG4143> was already <WG2235> filling <WG1072> up.

And He Himself <WG846> was in the stern, <WG4403> asleep <WG2518> on the cushion; <WG4344> and they awoke <WG1453> Him and said <WG3004> to Him, "Teacher, <WG1320> do You not care <WG3199> that we are perishing <WG622>?"

And being aroused, <WG1326> He rebuked <WG2008> the wind <WG417> and said <WG3004> to the sea, <WG2281> "Hush, <WG4623> be still. <WG5392>" And the wind <WG417> died <WG2869> down <WG2869> and it became <WG1096> perfectly <WG3173> calm. <WG1055>
And He said <WG3004> to them, "Why <WG5101> are you so <WG3779> timid <WG1169>? How <WG4459> is it that you have <WG2192> no <WG3756> faith <WG4102>?"

And they became very <WG3173> much <WG3173> afraid <WG5399> and said <WG3004> to one <WG240> another, <WG240> "Who <WG5101> then <WG686> is this, <WG3778> that even <WG2532> the wind <WG417> and the sea <WG2281> obey <WG5219> Him?"
